meanings.definition: To move or cause to move rapidly with a whirring sound.
meanings.sent1: The toy car would whirry around the room.
meanings.sent2: The fan blades whirry as they spin quickly.
meanings.sent3: The busy bee would whirry from flower to flower in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to whirry by as they raced against the clock.
meanings.sent5: The helicopter blades whirry loudly overhead, creating a sense of urgency.

meanings.sent1: The whirry of the blender filled the kitchen with noise.
meanings.sent2: The sudden whirry of wings startled the sleeping bird.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected whirry of the doorbell made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The constant whirry of the machinery in the factory was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The distant whirry of the wind through the trees added a soothing background noise.
